text:
Hi,

Concerning this tag, could you add a comment on how to add a new line inside the replace parameter ?

Because, naturaly, \n is being used without success. A search on Google retreives forum posts with people struggling with this one.

Apparently, the simple usage of ${line.separator} just works fine.

Thx!
creator: flop.m@usa.net
jglick@apache.org
text:
Matcher.appendReplacement Javadoc gives no indication that \n would be interpreted specially. Putting an actual newline in the script would not work due to XML whitespace parsing. Using 
 might work, though of course ${line.separator} may be what you wanted to begin with.
